channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road is flooded again, 10th November
item.description:
My autistic son attends Aspris Woodview School by bus. The flooding here meant he could not walk along the footpath to and from the bus stop and had to be rescued in the morning and afternoon by car. This is the second time I have had to report this (ref: 7046654 in January 2025). Whatever remedial work was undertaken before appears to be only a 'sticky plaster' over the problem, and it's likely more drainage is required please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Crockenhill Road, St Mary Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree on public land blocking the pavements, 10th November
item.description:
The tree outside the boundaries of the house at the top of Cromwell Avenue at the junction with Cromwell Close is overhanging the pavements in Cromwell Avenue and Cromwell Close. This makes it impossible to walk on the pavements at the junction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Church Lane, from A21,, 10th November
item.description:
As you turn into Church Lane from the A21 Bromley Common/Hastings Road. Large quantities of leaves are building up along the pavement and gutter. Along the entire length of Church Lane there are large mature trees which have now dropped all their leaves. Can these leaves be gathered up and taken away please. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Build up of leaves on the pavements, 10th November
item.description:
There is a huge build up of leaves and rubbish on the pavements and it is a safety hazard for pedestrians, people with prams, or wheelchair users. The recent rain has made the leaves very slippery and trying to navigate the pavements is quite difficult and very dangerous. There never seems to be any type of road sweeping done here, whereas just down the road in Sydenham I often see road sweepers clearing the pavements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Versailles Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
